page.title: 01Landscape of Springfield
page.content: The village of{Springfield}lies on the South-West border of the parish of{ {Cupar}. It is on the North bank of the {River Eden}and lies within two miles of Cupar. It also has a railway station on the main Edinburgh/Aberdeen line. It was once said that the whole of{ {Stratheden}was a land-locked sheet of water,it is from this that the name Springfield is derived.The land in and around Springfield is very flat.There are a lot of bits of uncultivated land,but it's not going to waste because the Forestery Commission have planted a new generation of trees. Just facing {Over Rankeilour}farm is a huge mansion called Rankeilour Estate. There is normally a lot of grassland because of the cows.
